turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Financial management for IT services.
turn.1: What is the importance of Financial management for IT services?
turn.2: Transparency of charging will encourage users to avoid expensive activities where slightly more inconvenient but far cheaper alternatives are available.
turn.3: what are some examples of the expensive activities?
turn.4: For example, a user might browse a dump on screen rather than printing it off.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Charging is arguably the most complex of the three sub-processes, requiring a large investment of resources and a high degree of care to avoid anomalies, where an individual department may benefit from behavior which is detrimental to the company as a whole.
turn.7: what is the most important aspect of the article?
turn.8: Charging policy needs to be simultaneously simple, fair and realistic.
turn.9: what is an example of a simple charging policy?
turn.10: Charging need not necessarily mean money changing hands (full charging).
turn.11: what is an example of a fair and realistic policy?
turn.12: It may take the form of information passed to management on the cost of provision of IT services (no charging), or may detail what would be charged if full charging were in place without transactions actually being applied to the financial ledgers (notional charging).
